qas.question: When did the agency acheive a semi-automated air traffic control system?
When was the Airline Deregulation act?
When did the nationwide strike by air traffic controlers union happen?
when did the FAA shift to a more step-by-step approach to providing air traffic controllers with more advanced equipment?
What helped operate radar in the new air-traffic control system?
When did the agency achieve fully automated air traffic control systems?
When was airline deregulation phased out?
What was the act that phased out airline deregulation?
When was the nationwide strike that forced flight restrictions but failed to shutdown the aerospace system?
What type of enhancement did the air traffic control system get to keep up with air traffic growth?

context: By the <a0_0><b5_0>mid-1970s<b5_0/><a0_0/>, the agency had achieved a semi-automated air traffic control system using both <b9_0>radar and <a4_0>computer technology<b9_0/><a4_0/>. This system required enhancement to keep pace with air traffic growth, however, especially after the <b7_0>Airline Deregulation Act of <a1_0><b6_0>1978<b7_0/><b6_0/><a1_0/> phased out the CAB's economic regulation of the airlines. A nationwide strike by the air traffic controllers union in <a2_0><b8_0>1981<b8_0/><a2_0/> forced temporary flight restrictions but failed to shut down the airspace system. During the following year, the agency unveiled a new plan for further automating its air traffic control facilities, but progress proved disappointing. In <a3_0>1994<a3_0/>, the FAA shifted to a more step-by-step approach that has provided controllers with advanced equipment.
